Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.pop3

Class POP3Server

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.Connector
      • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.Server
        • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.pop3.POP3Server
  • public class POP3Server
extends Server
    Connection factory for POP3 connections on a given port. This connector supports both standard POP3 (port 110) and POP3S (port 995), with transparent SSL/TLS support and STARTTLS capability.

    POP3 is defined in RFC 1939 with extensions in:

    • RFC 1957 - Implementation notes and recommendations
    • RFC 2449 - POP3 Extension Mechanism
    • RFC 2595 - TLS for POP3 (STLS command)
    • RFC 6816 - POP3 Support for UTF-8
    • RFC 8314 - Cleartext considered obsolete (use TLS)
    Author:
    Chris Burdess

      • getMailboxFactory

        public MailboxFactory getMailboxFactory()
        Returns the mailbox factory for this server.
        Returns:
        the mailbox factory, or null if not configured

      • setMailboxFactory

        public void setMailboxFactory​(MailboxFactory mailboxFactory)
        Sets the mailbox factory for creating mailbox instances. Each POP3 connection will use this factory to obtain a mailbox for the authenticated user.
        Parameters:
        mailboxFactory - the factory to create mailbox instances

      • getHandlerFactory

        public ClientConnectedFactory getHandlerFactory()
        Returns the handler factory for creating connection handlers.
        Returns:
        the handler factory, or null if using default behaviour

      • setHandlerFactory

        public void setHandlerFactory​(ClientConnectedFactory handlerFactory)
        Sets the handler factory for creating connection handlers.

        When set, each new connection will create a handler instance to control the connection behaviour. If not set, the connection uses default behaviour.

        Parameters:
        handlerFactory - the factory for creating handlers

      • getLoginDelayMs

        public long getLoginDelayMs()
        Returns the login delay in milliseconds. RFC 2449 section 4 recommends a minimum delay between failed authentication attempts to slow down brute-force attacks.
        Returns:
        the login delay in milliseconds

      • setLoginDelayMs

        public void setLoginDelayMs​(long loginDelayMs)
        Sets the login delay in milliseconds. This is enforced after failed authentication attempts.
        Parameters:
        loginDelayMs - the delay in milliseconds (0 to disable)

      • setLoginDelay

        public void setLoginDelay​(java.lang.String delay)
        Sets the login delay using a string with optional time unit suffix. Supported suffixes: ms, s, m, h (milliseconds, seconds, minutes, hours).
        Parameters:
        delay - the delay string (e.g., "5s", "500ms")

      • getTransactionTimeoutMs

        public long getTransactionTimeoutMs()
        Returns the transaction timeout in milliseconds. RFC 1939 section 3 recommends a minimum 10-minute timeout.
        Returns:
        the timeout in milliseconds

      • setTransactionTimeoutMs

        public void setTransactionTimeoutMs​(long transactionTimeoutMs)
        Sets the transaction timeout in milliseconds.
        Parameters:
        transactionTimeoutMs - the timeout in milliseconds

      • setTransactionTimeout

        public void setTransactionTimeout​(java.lang.String timeout)
        Sets the transaction timeout using a string with optional time unit suffix.
        Parameters:
        timeout - the timeout string (e.g., "10m", "600s")

      • isEnableAPOP

        public boolean isEnableAPOP()
        Returns whether APOP authentication is enabled.
        Returns:
        true if APOP is enabled

      • setEnableAPOP

        public void setEnableAPOP​(boolean enableAPOP)
        Sets whether APOP authentication is enabled. APOP provides challenge-response authentication without sending passwords in cleartext.
        Parameters:
        enableAPOP - true to enable APOP

      • isEnableUTF8

        public boolean isEnableUTF8()
        Returns whether UTF-8 support is enabled (RFC 6816).
        Returns:
        true if UTF-8 is enabled

      • setEnableUTF8

        public void setEnableUTF8​(boolean enableUTF8)
        Sets whether UTF-8 support is enabled. When enabled, the server advertises UTF8 capability.
        Parameters:
        enableUTF8 - true to enable UTF-8

      • isEnablePipelining

        public boolean isEnablePipelining()
        Returns whether command pipelining is enabled (RFC 2449 section 6.8).
        Returns:
        true if pipelining is enabled

      • setEnablePipelining

        public void setEnablePipelining​(boolean enablePipelining)
        Sets whether command pipelining is enabled. When enabled, clients can send multiple commands without waiting for responses.
        Parameters:
        enablePipelining - true to enable pipelining

      • newConnection

        protected Connection newConnection​(java.nio.channels.SocketChannel channel,
                                   javax.net.ssl.SSLEngine engine)
        Creates a new POP3 connection for the given socket channel. For STARTTLS support: if secure=false but engine!=null, the connection starts as plaintext but can be upgraded with STLS.
        Specified by:
        newConnection in class Connector
        Parameters:
        channel - the socket channel for the client connection
        engine - the SSL engine (null if no SSL context, non-null if STARTTLS-capable)
        Returns:
        a new POP3Connection instance

      • isSTARTTLSAvailable

        protected boolean isSTARTTLSAvailable()
        Checks if SSL/TLS context is available for STARTTLS.
        Returns:
        true if STARTTLS is supported, false otherwise
